wikipedia_page.main: Eric John Arnott, MA, FRCS, FRCOphth (12 June 1929 – 1 December 2011) was a British ophthalmologist and surgeon who specialized in cataracts, a condition which in many parts of the world still remains the principal cause of blindness.  He is known for inventing new surgical techniques for treatment of various ophthalmological disorders, and received professional awards for his contributions.
